Detailed Description

Native format for a trainer's Pokémon party in Generation I.

Field Documentation

◆ count

uint8_t pksav_gen1_pokemon_party::count

The actual number of Pokémon in the party (0-6).

◆ species

uint8_t pksav_gen1_pokemon_party::species[PKSAV_GEN1_PARTY_NUM_POKEMON+1]

The species indices of the Pokémon in the party.

When the party is viewed in-game, it is this value that determines what Pokémon is shown, not the pksav_gen1_pc_pokemon_t.species value.

The final index of this field should always be set to 0xFF.

◆ party

struct pksav_gen1_party_pokemon pksav_gen1_pokemon_party::party[PKSAV_GEN1_PARTY_NUM_POKEMON]

The actual Pokémon in the party.

◆ otnames

uint8_t pksav_gen1_pokemon_party::otnames[PKSAV_GEN1_PARTY_NUM_POKEMON][PKSAV_GEN1_POKEMON_OTNAME_STORAGE_LENGTH+1]

The names of each Pokémon's original trainer.

To access this value, you should use the function ::pksav_text_from_gen1 with a num_chars value of 10.

◆ nicknames

uint8_t pksav_gen1_pokemon_party::nicknames[PKSAV_GEN1_PARTY_NUM_POKEMON][PKSAV_GEN1_POKEMON_NICKNAME_LENGTH+1]

The nicknames of each Pokémon in the party.

To access this value, you should use the function ::pksav_text_from_gen1 with a num_chars value of 10.
